description:
Available in: English  *Uses location services*
Simple map viewer that works great to get a quick map of your current location or search for an address without having to wait for the native map application to load!  This is not intended to be a full-featured map application.

Note -- active GPS tracking really eats the battery.  It may also cause excessive map calls and blocking of your device for 24 hours.  Remember, this is not intended to replace navigation or Palm maps app - it's for a quick view of your location (assuming your GPS can get an accurate fix) or a known address.

Features:
 - Display map of current location via GPS
 - Track location and update map periodically (interval set in app preferences)
 - Show current speed and heading (in degrees)
 - Search for an address and display map
 - Select between Google Maps or Open Street Maps for address search and map display (in app preferences)
 - Zoom in & out
 - Pan map using arrows

Change log:
1.2.2
- Added map panning
- Fixed bug that occurred when hitting 'My Location' while tracking is turned on.
1.2.0
- Made the app available on the Pre3. No other changes.  Also fixing minimum OS version setting to 1.4, which I had inadvertently marked it for 2.0 and up with the last update, so it is available on legacy devices again.

1.1.8
- Added support info to help scene and move to main app catalog from web catalog

1.1.7
- Added help scene
- Re-packaged to fix app catalog issue with 1.1.6 update.

1.1.6
- Keep display on while tracking
- Configurable refresh rate for map while tracking

1.1.5
 - Cleanup of error messages and number formatting for initial public release.

1.1.4
 - Added preferences screen
 - Switch between Google & Open Street Map for drawing map
 - Preferences saved using cookie

1.1.3:
 - UI cleanup

1.1.2:
 - Added zoom control
versionNote:
- Added map panning
- Fixed bug that occurred when hitting 'My Location' while tracking is turned on.
